programs today the office for civil
rights
OCR at the US Department of Health and
Human Services announced that it is

agreement with the Oregon Department of
Human Services concerning the rights of
parents with disabilities an OD HS child
welfare program OCR initiated a
compliance review of OD HS following

verse based on stereotypical beliefs and

the parents participated in services

2017 the local County Circuit Court
dismissed
o DHS neglect petition involving the
younger of the two children terminated o
DHS is legal custody and ordered
reunification with the parents after
approximately 10 months of separation in
January 2018 the circuit court denied o
DHS's petition to terminate the parents
right to the older child and ordered
reunification with the parents after
four years of separation following data
requests and an on-site investigation of
OD HS CWP regional officers offices OCR
identified systemic deficiencies
regarding OD HSC WPS implementation of
his disability rights policies practices
and procedures to prevent discrimination
against parents with disabilities in
Oregon's child welfare system after OCR
conveyed these concerns to o DHHS o DHS
expressed willingness to work with OCR
to ensure full compliance with its
federal civil rights obligations so in
